description.precondition: The following users are in the database
HCP Brooke Tran (MID = 9000000085) is registered with the iTrust system with specialty Optometrist.
Patient Brody Franco (MID = 407) is registed with the iTrust system.
description.step: Log in as Brody Franco (MID = 407, password = pw)
Click the "Add Ophthalmology Office Visit Request" link under "Ophthalmology" from the sidebar
Enter/Select the following in the form: HCP: "Brooke Tran", Date: "12/20/2015", Time: "03:00 PM", Comment: "My eyes hurt"
Press "Request"
Click the "View Scheduled Ophthalmology Office Visits" link under "Ophthalmology" from the sidebar

expectedResults.eResult: After pressing "Request" the following message is displayed "Your Ophthalmology Office Visit Request has been saved and is pending."

A table should be displayed titled "My Scheduled Ophthalmology Office Visits" that contains the following entry: Doctor: "Brooke Tran", Appointment Date/Time: "12/20/2015 03:00 PM", Comments: "Read Comment", Status: "Pending"

description.step: Log in as Brooke Tran (MID = 9000000085, password = pw)

A table should be displayed titled "My Scheduled Ophthalmology Office Visits" that contains the following entry: Doctor: "Brooke Tran", Appointment Date/Time: "12/20/2015 03:00 PM", Comments: "Read Comment", Status: "Accepted"

description.precondition: The following users are in the database
HCP Lamar Bridges (MID = 9000000086) is registered with the iTrust system with specialty Ophthalmologist.
Patient Brody Franco (MID = 407) is registed with the iTrust system.
description.step: Log in as Lamar Bridges (MID = 9000000086, password = pw)
Click the "Add Surgical Ophthalmology Office Visit" link under "Ophthalmology" from the sidebar
Enter "407" into the text field labeled "Search by name or MID"
Click the button next to "Brody Franco" labeled "407"

Enter the following into the form: Date of visit: "10/14/2015", Visual Acuity OD: "20"/"40", Visual Acuity OS: "20"/"40", Sphere OD: "-3.25", Sphere OS: "-3.00", Cylinder OD: "-1.25", Axis OD: "50", Add OD: "+1.00", Add OS: "+1.00", Surgery: "Cataract surgery", Surgery Notes: "Surgery completed with no issues."
Press "Submit"

expectedResults.eResult: The user is redirected to the Surgical Ophthalmology homepage; the message "Surgical Ophthalmology Office Visit successfully added" is displayed.
The Office Visit that was just created is displayed as a link in "View Prior Surgical Ophthalmology Office Visits" with the title of the link as "10/14/2015"

description.precondition: The following users are in the database

description.step: Log in as Brooke Tran (MID = 9000000086, password = pw).
Click the "Add Surgical Ophthalmology Office Visit" link under "Ophthalmology" from the sidebar
Enter "408" into the text field labeled "Search by name or MID"
Click the button next to "Freya Chandler" labeled "408"
Enter the following into the form: Date of visit: "10/15/2015", Visual Acuity OD: "20"/"10", Visual Acuity OS: "20"/"40", Sphere OD: "+1.75", Sphere OS: "+17.50", Add OD: "+1.25", Add OS: "+1.25"
Press "Submit"
Change the following values in the form: Sphere OS: from "+17.50" to "+1.75"
Press "Submit"

expectedResults.eResult: After pressing Submit for the first time, the following error message is displayed "The following field is not properly filled in: [Sphere (OS): Double between -10 and 10, inclusive.]"
The user is redirected to the Surigcal Ophthalmology homepage and the message "Surgical Ophthalmology Office Visit successfully added" is displayed.
The Office Visit that was just created is displayed as a link in "View Prior Surgical Ophthalmology Office Visits" with the title of the link as "10/15/2015"

Patient Brody Franco (MID = 407) is registed with the iTrust system.
Test case testCreateOphthalmologyOfficeVisit has been run.

description.step: Log in as Kelly Doctor (MID = 9000000000, password = pw).
Click the "Add Ophthalmology Office Visit" link under "Ophthalmology" from the sidebar
Enter "407" into the text field labeled "Search by name or MID"
Click the button next to "Brody Franco" labeled "407"
Click the "View Ophthalmology Records" link under "Ophthalmology" from the sidebar
Click the link labeled "10/14/2015" under the list "View Prior Ophthalmology Office Visits"

expectedResults.eResult: After pressing the button next to "Brody Franco" labeled "407", you should be redirected to the page to create a regular Office Visit.
After clicking the link labeled "10/14/2015" a table titled "View Ophthalmology Records"should be displayed containing the following fields and values:
Patient Name: Brody Franco, Date of visit: 10/14/2015, Visual Acuity OD: 20/40, Visual Acuity OS: 20/40, Sphere OD: -3.25, Sphere OS: -3.0, Cylinder OD: -1.25, Axis OD: 50, Add OD: 1.0, Add OS: 1.0"

preconditions.precondition: The following users are in the database
HCP Brooke Tran (MID = 9000000085) is registered with the iTrust system with specialty Optometrist.
Patient Freya Chandler (MID = 408) is registed with the iTrust system.
Test case testInvalidSPHValue has been run.

description.step: Log in as Brooke Tran (MID = 9000000085, password = pw).
Click the "Ophthalmology Home" link under "Ophthalmology" from the sidebar
Enter "408" into the text field labeled "Search by name or MID"
Click the button next to "Freya Chandler" labeled "408"
Click the link labeled "10/15/2015" under the list "View Prior Ophthalmology Office Visits"
Change the following values in the form: Visual Acuity OD: from "20"/"10" to "20"/"15"
Press "Submit"

expectedResults.eResult: The user is redirected to the Ophthalmology homepage and the message "Ophthalmology Office Visit successfully edited" is displayed.
The Office Visit that was just edited is displayed as a link in "View Prior Ophthalmology Office Visits" with the title of the link as "10/15/2015"

description.precondition: DBBuilder and TestDataGenerator have been recently executed to ensure the existance of the foodentry table in the locally hosted database as well as the designated nutritionists and macronutrient patient data.

Under the Wellness Diary tab, select Macronutrients
View Expected Results 1

expectedResults.eResult: Bender Rodriguez is shown 3 graphs showing 5 days of each macronutrient intake, a graph of his total macronutrient intake against his Mifflin-St Jeor Data, and a totals graph of each macronutrient intake total over the 5 day period.

description.step: Log in as patient Derek Morgan (MID: 333, Password: pw)
Under the "View" tab in the selection menu on the left, press on the "My Food Diary" option.
Below the empty table (There are no entries yet), press on the "Add an entry to your Food Diary" link.

The resulting page should contain a form element with several pertinent text input fields. These include: Date Eaten (using mm/dd/yyyy formatting), Type of Meal, Name of Food, Number of Servings, Calories per Serving, Grams of Fat per Serving, Milligrams of Sodium per Serving, and Grams of Carbs, Sugar, Fiber and Protein per Serving.

description.precondition: Admin exists in database and has authenticated successfully.
description.step: Admin Chooses to View Hospital Visit Statistics
Admin Enters [Current Date minus 1 Year] and [Current Date]

expectedResults.eResult: Success: Then the administrator is presented with a bar chart.

In the bar chart, the x axis shows the months (the time goes by from left to right) from (including) the starting month/year to the ending month/year. The y axis shows the total number of office visits. For each month, the total numbers of two types of office visits are calculated and displayed as two bar separately: the bar on the left (colored in red) is for the office visits of patients less than 18 years old and the bar on the right (colored in blue) is for the office visits of patients equal to or greater than 18 years old.
The event is logged.

Click Add Record.
Edit the height field 999.9. (Testing a 3 digit number with one decimal place).
You must also select a 'Smoker?' option. Select Option "1 - Current every day smoker".
Click the "Add Record" button.

expectedResults.eResult: You are redirected back to the 'Basic Health History' tab and "Information Recorded" should be displayed in green. New height information is reflected in the table.

HCP enters patient MID "2"".

expectedResults.eResult: The table displayed below should be empty and "Found 0 records" should be displayed.

description.precondition: Patients meeting the care-needing criteria exist.

This test will use: An alive patient with age ] 50 years who has not had a flu shot - CPT code in { 90656, 90658, 90660 } - during the months Sept - Dec of: a) the last calendar year if retrieval time is NOT in Sept - Dec; OR b) the current calendar year otherwise.
An HCP exists.
description.step: The HCP successfully authenticates
The HCP clicks "Office Visit Reminders" link and selects the "flu shot needers" dropdown option.

expectedResults.eResult: Success: The System returns patients meeting the criteria; in this case, the patient from precondition 1.
Should specifically expect to see Patient Names: NoRecords Has, Bad Horse, Care Needs, and Random Person

description.step: LHCP 9000000000 clicks the "Document Office Visit" link under the "Office Visits" menu subheading.
LHCP 9000000000 searches for Random Person and clicks on the "1" button to proceed.
LHCP 9000000000 clicks the "10/10/2008" link.

LHCP 9000000000 prescribes Ibuprofen (code: 678771191) to Patient 1 under the "Add New" section by adding the following information: dosage: 10mg, start date: 10/10/2008, end date: 11/10/2008, instructions: Take three times daily with water.
LHCP 9000000000 clicks the "Add Prescription" button.

LHCP 9000000000 prescribes Aspirin (code: 081096) to Patient 1 under the "Add New" section by adding the following information: dosage: 10mg, start date: 10/10/2008, end date: 11/10/2008, instructions: "Take once daily with meal"
LHCP 9000000000 clicks the "Add Prescription" button.
LHCP 9000000000 reviews the interaction information and chooses not to proceed with the prescription by clicking the "Cancel" button.

expectedResults.eResult: LHCP 9000000000 is presented with the following information: Currently Prescribed: Ibuprofen. Start Date: 10/10/2008, End Date: 11/10/2008. Interactions: Ibuprofen - Aspirin. Description: May increase the potential for serious gastrointestinal toxicity. After canceling, LHCP 9000000000 remains on the Document Office Visit page with Ibuprofen as the only drug appearing under "Prescription."

test.actualResults: LHCP 9000000000 is presented with the following information: Currently Prescribed: Ibuprofen. Start Date: 10/10/2008, End Date: 11/10/2008. Interactions: Ibuprofen - Aspirin. After canceling, LHCP 9000000000 remains on the Document Office Visit page with Ibuprofen as the only drug appearing under "Prescription."

description.precondition: Kelly Doctor (HCP 1, MID: 9000000000, Password: pw) is an HCP in the system.
Random Person (Patient 1, MID:1, Password: pw) is in the system.

Kelly Doctor has documented an Office Visit for Random Person for 01/01/[current year] at "Health Institute Dr. E" (Hospital ID 1)
Log in as Kelly Doctor (HCP 1, MID: 9000000000, Password: pw)
Select "Document Office Visit" under "Office Visits" on the left side menu
Enter "1" into the text field
Click the button labeled "1" in the table
Click the button labeled "Yes, Document Office Visit" in the center of the screen
In the "Office Visit" field set, press the "Select Date" button and click 01/01/[current year] in the popup calendar
In the "Office Visit" field set, select "Health Institute Dr. E" from the "Hospital" drop down menu
Click the button labeled "Create" in the "Office Visit" field set

Kelly Doctor has documented immunization "influenza virus vaccine, live" (CPT-Code: 90660) for Random Person's office visit on 01/01/[current year]
After completing the above, or navigating to 01/01/[current year] office visit
From the "Immunizations" field set, Select "90660 - influenza virus vaccine, live" from the drop down box
Click the button labeled "Add Immunization" from the "Immunizations" fied se
description.step: Log in to iTrust as Random Person (patient 1, MID: 1, Password: pw).
Click "View My Records" link under the "View" on the left side menu
Click "Report" Link in the "Adverse Event" Column of the row of the "Immunizations" table associated with the "influenza virus vaccine, live" on [current year]-01-01
In the text box enter "I've been experiencing extreme fatigue and severe nausea following this immunization."
Click the button labeled "Save".

expectedResults.eResult: You are returned to the patient home screen with "Adverse Event Successfully Reported" at the top of the screen under the header.

The event has been logged
Viewable by clicking the "Transaction Log" link at the bottom of the screen

Kelly Doctor receives an email about the adverse event with the body: "Patient: Random Person (MID 1) Has Reported the following adverse event Drug: Influenza virus vaccine, live(90660) Description: I've been experiencing extreme fatigue and severe nausea following this immunization."
Viewable by clicking the "Show Fake Emails" Link at the bottom of the screen.

description.precondition: CreateUAP1 has passed and MID [8000000009] has authenticated successfully
description.step: Login as "UAP"
Choose "Add Patient option"
Enter the following information: First name: Lois Last name: Lane Contact email: clark@ncsu.edu
Click submit.

expectedResults.eResult: Patient has been added successfully with 3-digit MID.

expectedResults.eResult: Information successfully saved and event is logged

description.step: Enter the login information MID: "1" Password: "wrong". Repeat this step three times

expectedResults.eResult: After each failed login attempt the login should correctly update with the number of attempts. After the third faild attempt the user should be prompted for their MID, Password, and to fill out a ReCaptcha.

description.precondition: CreatePatient1 has passed.
description.step: Enter the login information MID: "1" Password: "wrong". Repeat this step three times
Enter the login infomration MID: "1" Password: "pw" and the correct Captcha

expectedResults.eResult: User should log in to the iTrust system.

description.precondition: CreatePatient1, CreateUAP1 have passed
description.step: Login as "UAP"
Choose "Document Office Visit" option
Enter MID 0000000001 and confirm selection by clicking the "1" button beside "Random Person" in the table.
Click "Yes, Document Office Visit" button
Enter the following fields under Office Visit section: Date: 11/21/2005 Hospital: Health Institute Dr. E Notes: "None"
Click "Create" button under Office Visit section.
Under the Diagnosis section choose "11.40 - Tuberculosis of the lung"" in the drop down box and click "Add Diagnoses"

expectedResults.eResult: Diagnosis record should be created and is visible under the Diagnoses section
The message "Diagnosis information successfully updated." is displayed.

description.precondition: CreatePatient1, CreateUAP1 have passed in the TestDataGenerator.
description.step: Login as "UAP".
Choose "Document Office Visit" under the "Other" heading.
Enter Patient MID "0000000001" and select the patient "Random Person" that matches the MID by clicking the button "1".
Click "Yes, Document Office Visit
Enter Fields: Date: 11/21/2005 Notes: "I like diet-coke".
For appointment Type enter General Checkup
Click the button "Create".

expectedResults.eResult: The record is added with a message displayed at the top of the page: "Information Successfully Updated".

description.precondition: HCP 9000000000, Patient 2, and UAP 8000000009 are in the system.
HCP 9000000000 has ordered lab procedure 10763-1 for patient 2 in an office visit on 7/20/2007.
UAP 8000000009 has authenticated successfully.
description.step: Login as "UAP"
Click on "View Laboratory Procedures".
Input MID 0000000002 and choose the matching MID.
Click the option to update the lab procedure 10763-1 with update date of 2007-07-20.
Inputs results: Negative. Commentary: All is well.

expectedResults.eResult: The results and commentary are stored. The event is logged. Email sent to Patient 2.

description.step: Log in as "ER".
Click on "Emergency Patient Report"
Input MID 0000000099 and choose the matching MID.

expectedResults.eResult: There is an Emergency Report for the Patient. The report states that there are no allergies on record, no critical diagnoses on record, and no immunizations on record.

description.step: Log in as "HCP 1".

expectedResults.eResult: Multiple Requests should be listed under Comprehensive Report History on the screen immediately after logging in.

description.precondition: Patient 2 and UAP 8000000009 are in the system.

Click on "Edit Patient List"
Input MID 0000000002 and choose the matching MID.
Click on "Add Andy Programmer" button

expectedResults.eResult: Screen confirming that "Patient Andy Programmer Added" appears, in the remotemonitoringlists table on the SQL server Patient MID 2 with HCPMID 8000000009 should appear.

description.precondition: Patient 1 is a registered iTrust user. - Patient 1 has authenticated successfully.Patient 1 has authority to self report telemedicine
description.step: 1. Patient 1 clicks the "Report Telemedicine Status" link under the Telemedicine Section on left.
2. Patient 1 enters 73.2 for height, and clicks "Report".
3. Patient 1 clicks the "Report Telemedicine Status" link.
4. Patient 1 enters 73.2 for height, and clicks "Report".

expectedResults.eResult: After step 2, Patient 1 should see the message "Information Successfully Added".
After step 4, Patient 1 should see the message "Invalid entry: Patient height entries for today cannot exceed 1.".

description.precondition: HCP 90000000000, Patient 1, and Patient 2 are registered iTrust users.Patient 1 is currently being monitored by HCP 9000000000.Patient 2 is a representative for Patient 1.Patient 1 has entered height and weight values of 70in. and 180lbs two days ago, at 8;19AM.Patient 2 has entered height and pedometer reading values of 70in. and 8153 steps for Patient 1 one day ago, at 7:48AM.Patient 1 has entered height and weight values of 70in. and 192.58lbs today at 7:17AM.LHCP 90000000000 has authenticated successfully.
description.step: 1. HCP clicks the "Monitor Patients" link under the "Telemedicine" menu subtitle.
2. HCP clicks the "Random Person (MID 1)" link in the table.
3. HCP views the telemedicine data for Patient 1 from three days ago to the current date by selecting the Select Data control and updating the State Date to 3 days ago. Select the Get Records button.

expectedResults.eResult: Under the Patient Weight/Pedometer Statistic section within the report, 3 rows are displayed in descending date order (newest to oldest).
Row one contains: Height = 70.0 Weight = 192.5 Reporter = Random Person
Row two contains Height = 70.0 pedometer Reading = 8153 Reporter = Andy Programmer
Row three contains Height = 70.0 Weight = 180.0 Reporter = Random Person.

description.precondition: HCP 90000000000, Patient 1, and Patient 2 are registered iTrust users. - Patient 1 is currently being monitored by HCP 9000000000. - Patient 2 is a representative for Patient 1. - Patient 1 has entered height and weight values of 70in. and 250lbs two month ago, at 6:00AM. - Patient 1 has entered height and weight values of 70in. and 180lbs one month ago, at 8:00AM. - Patient 2 has entered height and weight reading values of 70in. and 195 one month later at 7:00AM. - LHCP 90000000000 has authenticated successfully.
description.step: 1. HCP clicks the "Monitor Patients" link under the "Telemedicine" menu subtitle.
2. HCP clicks the "Random Person (MID 1)" link in the table.
3. HCP views the telemedicine data for Patient 1 from three days ago to the current date by selecting the Select Data control and updating the State Date to 3 days ago. Select the Get Records button.

expectedResults.eResult: Entry for today at 7:00AM should be highlighted in yellow. Entry for one month ago at 8:00AM should be highlighted in yellow.

expectedResults.eResult: Under the Patient Weight/Pedometer Statistic section within the report, 3 rows are displayed in descending date order (newest to oldest).

Row three contains Height = 70.0 Weight = 180.0 Reporter = Random Person.

description.step: 1. Open Login Page.
2. Attempt Login with MID=9000000001 and Password=laurie0001

description.precondition: Admin 9000000001 exists in the system. Admin is listed as "Admin" under "Sample Users" on the iTrust homepage.
description.step: 1.Log in as Admin 9000000001 from the iTrust homepage. Do this by clicking on 'Admin' under "Sample Users" on the lower left corner of the screen.
2. Click on the "Add HCP" link under "Add".
3. Type in "first" for the first name, "last" for the last name, "a@b.com" as email, and select "Heart Surgeon" as the specialty.
4. Click on the "Add personnel" button. "New HCP first last successfully added!" should be at the top of the screen.
5. Click on the "Display Database" link at the far bottom of the screen. Scroll down to the "personnel" heading to check Expected Results.

expectedResults.eResult: The new HCP should be added to the bottom of the table, and should have "Heart Surgeon" listed in the specialty field.

description.precondition: Kelly Doctor is an HCP. She is listed as "HCP 1" under Sample Users on the iTrust homepage.
Random Person is a patient registered with the iTrust system. Random Person is listed as "Patient 1" under Sample Users on the iTrust homepage.
Kelly Doctor is logged into iTrust. To do this, click on "HCP 1" under "Sample Users" on the iTrust homepage. She should be automatically logged in.
description.step: 1. Select the "Document Office Visit" link under Office Visits on the left side of the page.
2. On the resulting page, enter "Random Person" in the textbox under "Search by name or MID:". A table should appear under the textbox containing Random Person and his MID (1).
3. Click on Random Person's MID.
4. On the resulting page, select "Yes, Document Office Visit."
5. Enter the following visit information: Date: 01/28/2011 Hospital: Health Institute Dr. E Notes: Has flu.
6. Click the Create button.

7. Scroll down to "Patient Specific Instructions" and enter the following information: Name: Flu Diet URL: http://www.webmd.com/cold-and-flu/flu-guide/what-to-eat-when-you-have-the-flu Comment: "Eat a healthy diet to help you get over the flu faster! Take your vitamins and drink lots of fluids."
8. Click "Add Patient Instructions" button.
9. Scroll to the far bottom of the page and click on the "Display Database" link.
10. Scroll down to the "patientspecificinstructions" table.

expectedResults.eResult: The patient specific instructions for Random Person should be listed in the table. Name: Flu Diet URL: http://www.webmd.com/cold-and-flu/flu-guide/what-to-eat-when-you-have-the-flu Comment: "Eat a healthy diet to help you get over the flu faster! Take your vitamins and drink lots of fluids."

And for totals: - "12/12/2012", "1.5", "150"
Random Person clicks on the "Add an entry to your Exercise Diary" link at the bottom of the diary.
Random Person enters the following information in the fields, then clicks the submit button: - 12/13/2012 (date) - Cardio (type) - Biking (name) - 0.5 (hours worked) - -100 (calories)

expectedResults.eResult: Random Person stays on the Add Entry page, their diary is not updated, and they see an error message: "This form has not been validated correctly. The following field are not properly filled in: [Number of Calories Burned must be greater than 0]"

description.precondition: HCP Duyu Ivanlyft is registered and authenticated with the iTrust system.
Patient Random Person is registered and authenticated with the iTrust system.
Patient Random Person has the Exercise Diary entries from UC81.
description.step: Duyu Ivanlyft logs into iTrust.
Duyu Ivanlyft clicks on the "Patient Exercise Diaries" link in the "Patient Info" category on the left sidebar.
Duyu Ivanlyft types "1" into the Patient MID search box and selects Random Person.

expectedResults.eResult:
They should see the following entries: - "12/12/2012", "Weight Training", "Bench Press", "0.5", "50", "3", "10" - "12/12/2012", "Cardio", "Running", "1", "100"
And for totals: - "12/12/2012", "1.5", "150"

description.precondition: HCP Duyu Ivanlyft is registered and authenticated with the iTrust system.
Patient Random Person is registered and authenticated with the iTrust system.
Patient Random Person has no Exercise Diary entries.
description.step: Duyu Ivanlyft logs into iTrust.
Duyu Ivanlyft clicks on the "Patient Exercise Diaries" link in the "Patient Info" category on the left sidebar.
Duyu Ivanlyft types "1" into the Patient MID search box and selects Random Person.

expectedResults.eResult: They should see no entries, but this message instead: "The selected patient's exercise diary is empty. If you were expecting entries please try again later!"

description.precondition: Patient Random Person is registered and authenticated with the iTrust system.
Patient Random Person has no labels.
description.step: Random Person logs into iTrust.
Random Person clicks on the "My Labels" link in the "My Wellness Diary" category on the left sidebar.
Random Person types "Test" into the label name box and clicks "Create Label".

expectedResults.eResult: They should see a new entry added under "My Labels".

description.precondition: Patient Random Person is registered and authenticated with the iTrust system.
Patient Random Person has a "Test" label already created.
description.step: Random Person logs into iTrust.
Random Person clicks on the "My Labels" link in the "My Wellness Diary" category on the left sidebar.
Random Person clicks the "Edit Entry" button.
Random Person types "Updated" into the label name box and clicks "Submit".

expectedResults.eResult: Their label name should now be "Updated".

description.precondition: Patient Random Person is registered and authenticated with the iTrust system.
Patient Random Person has a "Test" label already created.
description.step: Random Person logs into iTrust.
Random Person clicks on the "My Labels" link in the "My Wellness Diary" category on the left sidebar.
Random Person clicks the "Delete Label" button.

expectedResults.eResult: They should no longer have any labels listed un "My Labels".

description.precondition: Patient Random Person is registered and authenticated with the iTrust system.
Patient Random Person has a "Test" label already created.
description.step: Random Person logs into iTrust.
Random Person clicks on the "My Food Diary" link in the "My Wellness Diary" category on the left sidebar.
Below the empty table (There are no entries yet), press on the "Add an entry to your Food Diary" link.

The resulting page should contain a form element with several pertinent text input fields. These include: Date Eaten (using mm/dd/yyyy formatting), Type of Meal, Name of Food, Number of Servings, Calories per Serving, Grams of Fat per Serving, Milligrams of Sodium per Serving, and Grams of Carbs, Sugar, Fiber and Protein per Serving.
Enter: Date Eaten: 02/04/2015
Type of Meal: Dinner
Name of Food: Fruity Pebbles
Number of Servings: 7
Calories per Serving: 110
Grams of Fat per Serving: 1
Milligrams of Sodium per Serving: 170
Grams of Carbs per Serving: 24
Grams of Fiber per Serving: 0
Grams of Sugar per Serving: 11
Grams of Protein per Serving: 1
Press "Add entry to Food Diary"
Random Person clicks on the "My Labels" link in the "My Wellness Diary" category on the left sidebar.
Random Person types "Test" into the label name box and clicks "Create Label".
Random Person selects "Food" from the dropdown box below "Apply a Label to your Diaries".
Random Person selects "Test" from the dropdown box below "Apply a Label to your Diaries".
Random Person types in "02/04/2015" into the start and end date boxes.
Random Person clicks "Apply Label".
Random Person clicks on the "My Food Diary" link in the "My Wellness Diary" category on the left sidebar.

expectedResults.eResult: They should see the "Test" label under all entries for "02/04/2015".
